sourceMeaningMnemonic: "For the  <radical>samurai</radical>, it is a <radical>jackhammer</radical> that they will <radical>lack</radical>." That is the latest <kanji>article</kanji> of the law written about samurai, hundreds of years after katana were taken away. This article was written with great <kanji>sincerity</kanji> by the government.
meaningInfo: By writing up new articles and laws they keep taking things away from samurai. First the katana, now jackhammers?
readingMnemonic: The one who wrote these <kanji>article</kanji>s with such <kanji>sincerity</kanji> was Genghis <reading>Khan</reading> (<ja>かん</ja>).
readingInfo: Genghis Khan knew that samurai were a threat to his kingdom, so he took away their secondary weapon, the jackhammer.
